front: Company wants to archive 100 TB of log data to cloud, test serverless analytics, and retain as long-term disaster recovery backup. Which two steps should they take?
back: Load logs into BigQuery for serverless analytics, and upload log files into Cloud Storage (Coldline/Archive storage classes) for long-term backup. BigQuery supports analytics queries, Cloud Storage Coldline/Archive provides cost-effective long-term storage. Cloud SQL doesn't support 100TB, Cloud Logging is for monitoring not analytics, and Bigtable is optimized for latency not analytics querying.

front: Mountkirk Games needs to generate anonymized usage reports and delete PII after a specific period with minimal cost. What should you do?
back: Archive audit logs in BigQuery and generate reports using Google Data Studio. BigQuery allows easy querying for report generation with low storage costs. Cloud Storage has no query language, Pub/Sub doesn't address log storage, and persistent disks are expensive for long-term storage.
